item.name: Injigo's Loving Embrace
entries: This net was woven by the jorogumo Injigo, who presented it as a gift to her gnome sweetheart, Mara, to keep her safe in their mountain cottage when Injigo left on hunting expeditions.
{@i Injigo's Loving Embrace} functions as a typical {@item net|APG}. You gain a +1 item bonus to {@skill Athletics} checks made to {@action Grapple} with the net.

You spin the net in the direction of an {@trait incorporeal|B1} creature within 30 feet that you can see. Lines of silken force whip out to lash around the incorporeal creature, who must attempt a {@dc 25} Reflex save to avoid becoming {@condition immobilized} until the end of your next turn. You can {@action sustain an activation||Sustain} this activation for up to 1 minute, and the creature must succeed at a {@dc 25} check to {@action Escape} the net.

You wrap the net around you like a blanket as you prepare to sleep. As long as you get 8 hours of sleep or analogous rest, you dream of writing love letters to someone you adore: this could be an actual paramour, someone you're interested in, or someone unknown whose identity you don't recall after waking. When you wake, you're filled with a sense of melancholia about those unsent letters, but these feelings distract you from other, more unpleasant thoughts, granting you resistance 5 to mental damage and a +1 item bonus to saving throws against {@trait mental} effects for the next 8 hours.

item.name: Kinburi's Sandals of Bounding
entries: These elevated wooden sandals once belonged to a haughty kitsune named Kinburi. It was well known that her swiftness and grace were unmatched, and observers described her as seeming to glide above the earth with each step. She often challenged others to wager on her speed, but as people began to grow wise, she was forced to conceal her identity or promise to forfeit her sandals if she lost.

These sandals give you a +1 item bonus to {@skill Athletics} checks to {@action High Jump} and {@action Long Jump}. In addition, when you use the Leap action, you can move 5 feet further if jumping horizontally or 3 feet higher if jumping vertically.

You loudly boast about your grace and agility, then take any combination of two {@action High Jump||High Jumps} or {@action Long Jump||Long Jumps}. You do not need to {@action Stride} first, and between the two jumps, you need only to come into contact with a physical object before making the second jump; this object doesn't need to be one that can bear your weight, or even be attached to the groundâ€”you can jump off from a floating feather or a thin branch or even off a paper wall as needed. The sandals' item bonus increases to +2 for these jumps.

item.name: Juubun's One Thousand Poems
entries: This well-worn manuscript is side stitched with fading lilac-colored thread. It is filled with poems written long ago by a philosopher named Seiji Juubun, which contain a lifetime of wisdom, presenting information and advice on a tremendous breadth of topics.

If your next action is to {@action Cast a Spell} that has the {@trait linguistic} trait and that targets 1 creature, you are overtaken by Juubun's spirit, and the spoken elements of your spell become impactfully poetic. If the target is an ally, your words inspire them and they gain 10 temporary Hit Points, which last for 1 minute. If the targeted creature is an enemy and the spell requires a saving throw, and if the enemy fails its saving throw, they become {@condition sickened 1} as a result of despair and sadness.

item.name: Vashu's Ninth Life
entries: This {@runeItem katana||+1 weapon potency||striking||ghost touch|} is made from a whisker stolen from the king of cats over three hundred years ago by a catfolk rogue named Vashu Vigaru. He sought the magic of the whisker to preternaturally extend his life, and some believe he still lives, having successfully divested himself of the sword to escape the king's wrath in the end.

You extend your senses through the blade, allowing you to react to nearby movement. {@i Vashu's Ninth Life} gains the {@trait parry} trait and raises itself into parrying position, granting you a +1 circumstance bonus to AC until the start of your next turn.

entries.trigger: You slay a living creature with {@i Vashu's Ninth Life}
entries: A portion of the slain creature's life force travels through the blade and into your soul, bolstering your own life. You gain the benefits of the {@feat Diehard} feat for 1 minute. This causes you to die from the {@condition dying} condition at dying 5 rather than dying 4.
